physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features a woman in a bathing suit, sitting on a beach towel, on sand. Her legs are outstretched and she is facing downwards. She is seen adjusting something behind her head. There are some magazines on the ground on the right side of the photograph. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of Corporal A. Silver at the beach
subject_terms_2: Photographs Portrait photography Women Beaches Recreation
